strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
There's plenty going on in Northwest Arkansas, pretty much always. Here's a list of a few things happening this weekend:

  • Up, up and away: The 2nd Annual SOAR NWA is back -- a hot air balloon festival at the Drake Field airport is this Saturday.
  • Bicycle ride: Go support the cyclists in the Joe Martin Stage Race sweeping the streets of Fayetteville.
  • At the drive-In: Free guy and Jungle Cruise are showing this weekend at the 112 drive-in.
  • Music city: Practically anywhere you go, really, music is in the streets with Music Festival Weekend.
  • And a show: American Mariachi, a music-filled comedy, is at Theatre Squared through Sunday.
  • For you country-lovin' folks: It's not too late to see Luke Bryan at the AMP tonight at 7p.
  • Fair fun: The Washington County Fair is ready for you. The last day is tomorrow, so go have some fun!
  • Midnight art: You're invited to Crystal Bridges' Art Night Out for a night of celebration and art-making.

Have fun this weekend, and see you Monday!
